bug.short_desc: Cannot set local folders as "Draft" and "Sent"

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20110321 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110307 Lightning/1.0b2 Lanikai/3.1.9
If I try to set my local Sent- and/or Draft-Folder as Default for my IMAP-account, TB switches these settings back to their online-counterparts when restarted. Meanwhile "Archive" and "Templates" are set to "Local Folder" though they exist neither online nor locally. This error is not to be seen easily as TB switches the settings to read only "Sent" (for example) without indicating the folder's location. Only by realizing that TB keeps saving Emails online instead of locally I found it. Nothing of this left any traces in TB's error-console.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. create an IMAP-account (with Sent-Folder) 2. create a local folders named like the IMAP-Folders 3. In account-settings of the IMAP-account set "save copies into" to the folder "Sent" in "Local Folders" 4. restart TB 5. send mail and search for its "Sent"-copy Actual Results: TB forgets about the settings and returns to the Default - the IMAP-Folders. (Copy will be found there)
Expected Results: Copy should be saved to the local Sent-folder; TB should keep the settings as set by user
